p: On longer time scales, atmospheric greenhouse gas concentrations (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, 2013), sea surface temperatures (Hoerling et al., 2008), and climate oscillations (Chylek et al., 2016; Schleussner et al., 2014; Stolpe et al., 2017) contribute to temperature variability and trends by influencing the above‐mentioned immediate drivers. For example, expressing local near‐surface air temperature as a linear function of global mean temperature, over 90% of the local multidecadal temperature trend can be explained (Sutton et al., 2015).
